DataElement.preferredName: Biospecimen Domain Biospecimen Block Accession Number Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Block Accession Number of the biospecimen collected.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Biospecimen Domain Biospecimen Block Accession Number
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A findings domain that documents biospecimen handling information.:Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products._A rectangular area in a city surrounded by streets and usually containing several buildings._A control number unique to an object.  It is used to identify the object among other objects in a collection.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A findings domain that documents biospecimen handling information.

Concepts.definition: A findings domain that documents biospecimen handling information.

Property.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products._A rectangular area in a city surrounded by streets and usually containing several buildings._A control number unique to an object.  It is used to identify the object among other objects in a collection.

Concepts.definition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.
A rectangular area in a city surrounded by streets and usually containing several buildings.
A control number unique to an object.  It is used to identify the object among other objects in a collection.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.
